title: Tian Shan
summary: The Tian Shan,[note 1] also known as the Tengri Tagh[1] or Tengir-Too,[2] (Old Turkic: 𐰴𐰣 𐱅𐰭𐰼𐰃‎; Uighur: تەڭرىتاغ; Chinese: 天山) meaning the Mountains of Heaven or the Heavenly Mountain, is a large system of mountain ranges located in Central Asia. The highest peak in the Tian Shan is Jengish Chokusu, at 7,439 metres (24,406 ft) high. Its lowest point is the Turpan Depression, which is 154 m (505 ft) below sea level.[3]
